intro: Humata cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's humata, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
